generif.text: Three human proteins essential for centromere/kinetochore structure and function, hMis18alpha, hMis18beta, and M18BP1, the complex of which is accumulated specifically at the telophase-G1 centromere, are identified.[Mis18alpha, Mis18beta, M18BP1]
These results indicate that knockdown of OIP5 may induce apoptosis in cancer cells.
OIP5 expression was significantly associated with poor prognosis of lung and esophageal cancer patients
expression of AURKC, OIP5, PIWIL2 and TAF7L differed between patients with Acute myeloid leukemia, myelodysplastic syndrome and healthy controls in a gender-dependent manner
this study showed betaTrCP-mediated regulation of Mis18beta stability is a mechanism to restrict centromere function of Mis18 complex from late mitosis to early G1 phase.
Mis18beta binds with and specifies the centromere localization of HJURP.
Over-expression of OIP5 was observed in breast tumors.
Stable binding of Mis18alpha-Mis18beta heterotetramer to centromeres in telophase licenses them for CENP-A deposition.
the Mis18 complex contains dual CENP-C recognition motifs that are combinatorially required to generate robust centromeric localization that leads to CENP-A deposition

OIP5 over-expression inhibited hsa-miR-139-5p expression, antagonized its functions and led to the de-repression of its endogenous target NOTCH1, which was a core oncogene in promoting breast cancer progression.
The authors demonstrate that CDK1 controls Mis18 complex recruitment to centromeres by regulating oligomerization of M18BP1 through the Mis18alpha:Mis18beta scaffold.
These findings suggest that OIP5 may be involved in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) growth and metastasis and that miR-15b-5p inhibits OIP5-mediated oncogenic signaling in HCC.
High OIP5 expression is associated with bladder cancer.
interaction network might function as an oncogene in bladder cancer progression
Mitofusin 2 knockdown altered Neisseria gonorrhoeae opacity-associated-interacting protein 5 (OIP5) expression.
LncRNA OIP5-AS1 modulated the expression of Bcl-2 by targeting miR-448 in lung adenocarcinoma cells.
E3 ubiquitin ligase RNF123 targets LMNB1, Rb protein and LAP2alpha for proteasomal degradation.
LncRNA OIP5-AS1 suppressed cell viability, promoted radio-induced apoptosis, and enhanced the radiosensitivity of CRC cells by regulating DYRK1A expression through miR-369-3p.
FN1 expression was regulated by the oncogenic long noncoding RNA (lncRNA) OIP5-AS1 through sponging miR-200b-3p.
OIP5 knockdown rescues glioma cells following lomustine treatment.

This study showed the role of Lactobacilli in down-regulation of TSGA10, AURKC, OIP5 and AKAP4 genes. Such expression change might be involved in the anticancer effects of these Lactobacilli. The underlying mechanisms of these observations are not clear but epigenetic modulatory mechanisms may participate in this process.

The upregulation of OIP5 mRNA was observed in nasopharyngeal carcinoma (NPC) tissues from two Gene Expression Omnibus datasets. Expression of OIP5 mRNA was significantly upregulated in several NPC cell lines compared to normal nasopharyngeal cells. Knockdown of OIP5 remarkably decreased the expression of p-JAK2 and p-STAT3 protein in NPC cells. Data indicated that OIP5 promoted NPC progression by modulating JAK2/STAT3.
the overall results demonstrated the involvement of OIP5 in the progression of liver cancer and its mechanism of action.
Long non-coding RNA OIP5-AS1 promotes the growth of gastric cancer through the miR-367-3p/HMGA2 axis.
OIP5-AS1 promotes the progression of gastric cancer cells via the miR-153-3p/ZBTB2 axis.
Inhibitory role of long non-coding RNA OIP5-AS1 in rheumatoid arthritis progression through the microRNA-448-paraoxonase 1-toll-like receptor 3-nuclear factor kappaB axis.
LncRNA OIP5-AS1 facilitates ox-LDL-induced endothelial cell injury through the miR-98-5p/HMGB1 axis.
Opa-Interacting Protein 5 Expression in Human Glioma Tissues Is Essential to the Biological Function of U251 Human Malignant Glioma Cells.
OIP5-AS1 specifies p53-driven POX transcription regulated by TRPC6 in glioma.
Lnc-OIP5-AS1 exacerbates aorta wall injury during the development of aortic dissection through upregulating TUB via sponging miR-143-3p.
LncRNA OIP5-AS1 affects the biological behaviors of chondrocytes of patients with osteoarthritis by regulating micro-30a-5p.

Long Non-Coding RNA OIP5-AS1 Inhibits the Proliferation and Migration of Esophageal Squamous Carcinoma Cells by Targeting FOXD1/miR-30a-5p Axis and the Effect of Micro- and Nano-Particles on Targeting Transfection System.
Characterization of Opa interacting protein 5 as a new biomarker and therapeutic target for oral cancer.
Long non-coding RNA Opa interacting protein 5-antisense RNA 1 binds to micorRNA-34a to upregulate oncogenic PD-L1 in non-small cell lung cancer.
Opa interacting protein 5 promotes proliferation and migration of trophoblast cells via activating STAT3 pathway.
The role of OIP5 in the carcinogenesis and progression of ovarian cancer.
[H3K27 acetylation promotes lncRNA OIP5-AS1 transcription and induces apoptosis of nasal epithelial cells in allergic rhinitis through up-regulation of TLR4].

name: Opa interacting protein 5

reactome.name: Deposition of new CENPA-containing nucleosomes at the centromere

summary: The protein encoded by this gene localizes to centromeres, where it is essential for recruitment of CENP-A through the mediator Holliday junction recognition protein. Expression of this gene is upregulated in several cancers, making it a putative therapeutic target. Two transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Dec 2015].
